result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky T Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court-ordered financial obligations shall be paid directly to the La Crosse County Clerk of Court. If the defendant is not able to pay the amount in full, the first payment shall be made within 90 days with monthly payments to follow. Failure to make the first payment or any subsequent payments, may result in collection through State Debt Collection.

Pay DOC Supervision fees.

Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricky T Smith

defendant.name: Smith, Ricky T
defendant.address: No Permanent Address, La Crosse, WI 54601

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent - unable to forward

9:06 am Defendant Ricky T Smith in custody and in court with attorney Thomas J Rhodes.  Attorney Courtney Kay Strittmater in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Rhodes:  Mr. Smith was brought into jail early last month.  During some of our discussions, I 've had reason to doubt his competency....  After further conversations, I changed my thought and felt like he was comming off drugs..... I do believe he is now competent. This offer is a fair resolution so he doesn't sit in jail any longer.....
Court goes over Mr. Rhodes comments about competency.  Do you feel, today, that you have an understanding of the process?  Smith:  Yes.  Court addresses Mr. Smith further.  Has the examination been done?  Rhodes:  No.  It was to be done on Friday and the examiner pushed it back.....  Mr. Smith and I discussed, at a bond hrg, what he was charged with.....  He understood the charges he had and came to an agreement that he did, in fact, had these charges.   Court:  Ms. Strittmater, do you have any comment on this?  Strittmater:  No.
COURT:  The Court has reason to raise competency if they feel it's appropriate.....  Mr. Rhodes has had the opportunity to spend more time with Mr. Smith.  He's been in custody on drug usage and affects his thinking.....  Mr. Rhodes has been able to condlude that the symptoms her was observing were more related to drug use than mental illness....  Mr. Rhodes, you're asking to withdraw the request for a comp. eval.?  Rhodes:  Yes.  It hasn't been done yet.
COURT will grant the request to withdraw the request for a comp. eval..  Mr. Smith is competent to proceed.
Plea Questionnaire filed - signed/understands
22CF-273  Count 2 - Misd. Bail Jumping   GUILTY.   Count 1 - Dismissed but read-in
21CM-749  Count 1 - Resisting an Officer (Misd)  GUILTY.  Count 2 - Misd. Bail Jumping -new crime  GUILTY.
20CM-984, 21CM-645, 21CM-735 and 22CM-103 and dismissed but read-in.
Rights/elements gone over.
COURT finds the pleas are F, V & I made.  Factual Basis.  Found guilty and convicted.
Strittmater feels this probation is appropriate so he can get the help he needs.....  Rhodes:  Mr. Smith doesn't want to be in this place he's in right now.  He's working with CouleeCap to get a residence.  He's also been working with JSS in the fresh start program....  Smith comments.  Court comments.

SENTENCE withheld on each count
18 mos. probation on each count - concurrent
Conditions:
Undergo any risks and needs that the Dept. may deem appropriate and comply with any treatment recommendations
Restitution of $1,815.04 plus the surcharge to A.S in 20CM-984
22CF-273 CC of $443 + the add'l $67 VW surcharge and the $200 DNA surcharge
21CM-749 - same costs, fees and surcharges as in 22CF-273 are remitted
47 days jail credit if probation is revoked

Appeal rights advised
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Competency hearing on May 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
for Competency Exam by DHS e/signed by EML
Competency hearing on April 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:33 am Defendant Ricky T Smith in custody and in court with attorney Thomas J Rhodes.  Attorney Courtney Kay Strittmater in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Rhodes:  I filed a motion for competency yesterday.... Strittmater no objections.  No victim notification issues.
COURT will order a competency evaulation.  Strittmater to prepare order.
COMP HRG:  4/29 at 2:00 pm      TWB
Court:  Time limits are suspended.
Smith asks for s sig. bond....
Court:  I'm not going to change the bond right now, Mr. Smith.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Def in custody w/Atty Davis for Rhodes
$500 cash bond set w/cond: no contact w/AmericInn, refer to JSS , comply w/JSS bail monitoring
PH: 4/21 @ 11 (TWB)
